abstract: Gmail users can now have instant-message conversations with users of AOL’s AIM system, fulfilling a key term of the deal in which Google invested $1 billion in AOL. The message services of Yahoo and MSN are linked to each other but not to Google or AOL.
snippet: Gmail users can now have instant-message conversations with users of AOL’s AIM system, fulfilling a key term of the deal in which Google invested $1 billion in AOL. The message services of Yahoo and MSN are linked to each other but not to Google o...
lead_paragraph: Google’s $1 billion investment in AOL may not have been the most financially savvy move as an investment. (Most analysts think AOL is worth far less than the $20 billion value that Google put on it.) But Google did get some payoff today.

headline.main: A Year Later: Chat on AIM through GMail

abstract: When friends and family of Ann Marie McNally search for the deceased woman’s name in Google, they come across several distasteful posts — all exemplary of the spam that some fear is taking over search engine results.
lead_paragraph: When friends and family of Ann Marie McNally search for the deceased woman’s name in Google, they come across several distasteful posts — all exemplary of the spam that some fear is taking over search engine results.

headline.main: Hacking Rings Take Advantage of Death in Boston
